info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Cleveland, southern Gaston, northern York and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Shelby, or near Kings Mountain State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, York, Shelby, Rock Hill, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly, Belmont, Bessemer City, South Gastonia and Tega Cay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
